aston.group20.GUIview

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • aston.group20.GUIview.GUI

  • public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
    The GUI class is used to provide the user with a graphical interface so that they can interact with the program. It allows them to change the various probabilities of creating aircraft as well as the length of the simulation. It gives them both a brief and a detailed view of the results of the simulation, and also allows the user to save the detailed information to a text file in a location of their choice.
    Version:
    1.0, April 2014
    Author:
    Group_20

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI()
        Creating a new GUI, which will give the user a graphical interface with which to interact with the program. It will allow the user to adjust various variables regarding the simulation, giving them full control over how it should run.
        See Also:
        to understand the methods used

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • openReport

        private void openReport()
        This method is called from the action listener on the Run button in the GUI constructor/on the mainframe. It opens the smaller of the two report windows, which shows short details regarding the currently run simulation. Buttons will be included which allow the user to run the simulation again, as well as one that will allow the user to show more detailed information about the simulation.

      • openLongReport

        private void openLongReport()
        This method is called from the action listener on the Details button in the openReport method/window. It opens the larger of the two report windows, which displays detailed information regarding the currently run simulation. Buttons are included that allow the user to save the results of the simulation to a text file of their choice, as well as one that will return the user to the smaller report window.

      • exitApp

        private void exitApp()
        Helper method to ensure consistency in leaving application. With credit to Aston University Computer Science.

      • runSimulation

        private void runSimulation()
        This method is called when the simulation is required to run, e.g. when the Run button is pressed on the mainframe, or when the Run Again button is pressed on the smaller report window. It runs the simulation for the value selected on the length slider, and adds the results to the results text area.

      • resetSimulation

        private void resetSimulation()
        This method is called when the simulation is first run, or is rerun, so that the the changes to the mainframe can be accounted for, e.g. a change in the seed or strategy. It resets the simulation, updates the variables and clears the report text.

      • setProbabilities

        private void setProbabilities()
        This method is called from the resetSimulation method; it gets the value of the three probability sliders (commercial, glider, light) and applies those values to the Simulation variable using the setProbabilities in the Hangar class.
        See Also:
        resetSimulation(), Hangar.setProbabilities(double, double, double)

      • setStrategy

        private void setStrategy()
        This method is called from the resetSimulation method; it gets the selected index of the strategy combo box and then selects that strategy in the Simulation class.
        See Also:
        resetSimulation(), in the Simulator class.

      • setSeed

        private void setSeed()
        This method is called from the resetSimulation method; it gets the selected index of the seed combo box and then applies that seed to the Hangar and AirControlTower objects.
        See Also:
        resetSimulation(), Hangar.setSeed(int), AirControlTower.setSeed(int)

      • getSimulationDetails

        private java.lang.String getSimulationDetails()
        This method is called from the longReport window/the openLongReport method. It is essentially used as the header of the report to display summary information. It is very useful for saved text files, as the user can see what seed/probabilities/etc was used for a simulation.

      • centreWindow

        private static void centreWindow(java.awt.Window frame)
        This method centres the GUI window and works on all screen sizes. With credit to Don @ StackOverflow.
        Parameters:
        frame - the window/frame to be centred
